data.text:
Understanding "How Old Was Robert Mitchum When He Died"

Robert Mitchum was an acclaimed American actor known for his distinctive voice, rugged good looks, and versatile performances. His career spanned over five decades, and he appeared in more than 130 films. Mitchum's notable works include "The Night of the Hunter" (1955), "Cape Fear" (1962), and "The Yakuza" (1975).

Mitchum passed away on July 1, 1997, at the age of 79. His death was attributed to complications from lung cancer and emphysema. Mitchum's passing marked a significant loss for the film industry, and he remains remembered as one of the most iconic actors of his generation.

Mitchum's death marked a significant loss for the film industry. He was a versatile actor who could play a wide range of roles, from villains to heroes. His performances were often characterized by a sense of world-weariness and cynicism, which made him relatable to audiences. Mitchum's legacy continues to inspire actors and filmmakers today.

Calculating Age at Death: Knowing the date of death allows us to calculate the exact age at which Robert Mitchum died. By subtracting his birthdate (August 6, 1917) from his date of death, we find that he was 79 years, 10 months, and 25 days old when he passed away.

Cause of Death

The cause of Robert Mitchum's death, complications from lung cancer and emphysema, is closely connected to the question "how old was Robert Mitchum when he died." This information is significant because it provides insight into the health issues he faced and the factors that may have contributed to his death at the age of 79.

Lung cancer and emphysema are both serious respiratory diseases that can significantly impact a person's health and life expectancy. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer death worldwide, and emphysema is a chronic lung disease that causes shortness of breath and other respiratory problems. Both diseases are often caused by smoking, and Mitchum was a lifelong smoker.

The fact that Mitchum died from complications from lung cancer and emphysema at the age of 79 suggests that these diseases may have contributed to his relatively early death. The average life expectancy for men in the United States in 1997 was 74 years, and Mitchum lived five years longer than this. However, it is important to note that life expectancy is just an average, and many factors can influence an individual's lifespan.

In conclusion, the cause of Robert Mitchum's death, complications from lung cancer and emphysema, is an important piece of information that helps us understand his health issues and the factors that may have contributed to his death at the age of 79. This information is significant because it provides context for his death and highlights the importance of lung health and smoking cessation.

Legacy

The legacy of Robert Mitchum as one of the most iconic actors of his generation is closely connected to his age at death. Mitchum died at the age of 79, which was relatively old for an actor of his time. This longevity allowed him to have a long and successful career, during which he starred in over 130 films and became known for his distinctive voice, rugged good looks, and versatile performances.

Mitchum's legacy is also connected to the cause of his death, which was complications from lung cancer and emphysema. These diseases are often caused by smoking, and Mitchum was a lifelong smoker. The fact that he was able to live and work for so long despite these health issues is a testament to his strength and resilience.

Mitchum's legacy as an iconic actor is also due to the fact that he died at a time when Hollywood was undergoing a significant transformation. The Golden Age of Hollywood, which Mitchum was a part of, was coming to an end, and a new generation of actors and filmmakers was emerging. Mitchum's death marked the end of an era, and he is remembered as one of the last great stars of that era.

In conclusion, the connection between "Legacy: Remembered as one of the most iconic actors of his generation" and "how old was robert mitchum when he died" is complex and multifaceted. Mitchum's age at death, cause of death, and the context of his death all played a role in shaping his legacy. He is remembered as one of the most iconic actors of his generation because of his longevity, his talent, and his ability to adapt to the changing landscape of Hollywood.

Notable Works

The connection between Robert Mitchum's notable works and his age at death is significant because it sheds light on his career trajectory and the impact of his performances on his legacy. Mitchum died at the age of 79, having starred in over 130 films. However, it is his performances in "The Night of the Hunter" (1955), "Cape Fear" (1962), and "The Yakuza" (1975) that are considered his most iconic and critically acclaimed.

These three films showcase Mitchum's versatility as an actor and his ability to portray complex and challenging characters. In "The Night of the Hunter," he plays a charismatic but evil preacher who marries a widow in order to steal her children's inheritance. In "Cape Fear," he plays a psychopathic ex-convict who seeks revenge on the family of the lawyer who sent him to prison. And in "The Yakuza," he plays an American detective who becomes embroiled in the world of the Japanese mafia.

Mitchum's performances in these films were not only critically acclaimed, but they also had a significant impact on his career. "The Night of the Hunter" is often considered one of the greatest films noir ever made, and it helped to establish Mitchum as a leading man in Hollywood. "Cape Fear" is a classic thriller that has been remade several times, and it is considered one of Mitchum's most iconic roles. And "The Yakuza" is a critically acclaimed crime drama that showcased Mitchum's ability to play complex and sympathetic characters.

In conclusion, the connection between Robert Mitchum's notable works and his age at death is significant because it highlights the impact of his performances on his career and legacy. These three films showcased his versatility as an actor and his ability to portray complex and challenging characters. They helped to establish him as one of the most iconic actors of his generation, and they continue to be enjoyed by audiences around the world.
